name: HTML5
description: The standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.

name: CSS3
description: A style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language

name: JavaScript
description: A programming language that is one of the core technologies of the World Wide Web

name: Bootstrap
description: A free and open-source CSS framework directed at responsive, mobile-first front-end web development.

name: Vue.JS
description: an open-source model–view–viewmodel front end JavaScript framework for building user interfaces and single-page applications.

name: Angular.JS
description: a JavaScript-based open-source front-end web framework for developing single-page applications

name: Python
description: A high-level, interpreted, general-purpose programming language.

name: Ruby
description: An interpreted, high-level, general-purpose programming language which supports multiple programming paradigms.

name: PHP
description: A general-purpose scripting language geared toward web development

name: Java
description: A high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

name: C++
description: A general-purpose programming language created by Danish computer scientist Bjarne Stroustrup as an extension of the C programming language, or 'C with Classes'.

name: Node.js
description: an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on the V8 engine and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.

name: VSCode
description: A source-code editor made by Microsoft for Windows, Linux and macOS.

name: Homebrew
description: A free and open-source software package management system that simplifies the installation of software on Apple's operating system, macOS, as well as Linux.

name: GitBash
description: A software for tracking changes in any set of files
